Difficulty in building team cohesion: When team members are not physically present in the same location, it can be harder to build team cohesion and rapport, which can impact productivity and morale.
Time zone differences: If team members are located in different time zones, it can be difficult to coordinate meetings and work hours, leading to potential delays in project completion.
Technology issues: Depending on the quality of internet connectivity, remote employees may experience technical difficulties that can impact their ability to complete tasks on time.

Lack of accountability: When team members are working remotely, it can be difficult to monitor their progress and ensure that they are meeting expectations, which can lead to potential accountability issues.
Limited resources: Remote employees may not have access to the same resources as their in-person counterparts, which can impact their ability to complete tasks effectively.
